Key Match Events: Matthew Boyd led the Guardians to a 6-4 victory over the White Sox.
Boyd recorded two strikeouts within the first eight pitches of the game.
Boyd struck out a season-high nine hitters.
The White Sox scored all four of their runs in the third inning, but only one was earned due to a throwing error by Andrés Giménez.
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Boyd and Austin Hedges prepared for the game by reviewing scouting reports and taking notes on the White Sox offense.
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Boyd expressed that he felt really good during the game despite some challenges.
Austin Hedges noted that Boyd was still striking out hitters even though he didn't have his 'A' stuff.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boyd's performance helped the Guardians maintain a four-game lead over the Royals in the AL Central standings.
Boyd has limited his opponents to one earned run or fewer in five of his six starts since coming off the injured list.
